title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
author: Archive

posts.post_title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
posts.post_content:
Posted By: JP
I bow down to Brian W. and am officially giving up on creating a T-206 Brown Hindu back set.  These cards are just in too high of demand for me to keep competing and overpaying just to get them.  So I've listed them on eBay, but am willing to pull any auction for Net54ers.  I've listed 18 so far

[url]http://search.ebay.com/_W0QQfgtpZ1QQfrppZ25QQsassZjmpkcp[/url]

but will be listing 30 or so more over the next few weeks.  So e-mail me if you are interested in any of these Brown Hindus for now, and I'll add more as they come along.  Feel free to make any offer to jmpkcp@gmail.com but REMEMBER to make your offers MORE THAN 24 HOURS before the close of the auction so I can still pull them from eBay.

posts.post_title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Scott
I don't know this back, but is there a Luther Taylor Brown Hindu T206.  If there is one and you have it, I'd be very interested.  Thanks, Scott
scottg@accessmfgsys.com

posts.post_title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Craig W
Scott,

I'm sure someone will correct me if i'm wrong, but I believe Luther "Dummy" Taylor is a 350 Only Series card, and I don't think Hindus (brown or red) were in that series.  I think he's buried in Baldwin, KS (just south of Lawrence).  Someday I'd like to get up that way and view his grave marker.

Craig

posts.post_title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Jim Rivera
no Luther "Dummy" Taylor Hindu

posts.post_title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
posts.post_content:
Posted By: MB3
You know JP if you would relax and maybe enjoy building the set over time you could complete it. The set is obviously a tough task and to think you could complete it in a month or two is ridiculous. I would not sell the cards you already have, just be patient and over time you can do it.

posts.post_title: FS: Brown Hindu T-206's - getting out of this set
posts.post_content:
Posted By: JP
Relaxing is exactly what I'm trying to do.  It had nothing to do with trying to finish the set in a month.  It more had to do with each opportunity to get one of these Hindus became a scramble.  There are so many people interested in rare backs at the moment, I'm having to pay a premium each time just to add a new one to my collection.  So I'd rather liquidate, step back, relax and rethink what I really want to do.  T-206s will always be my favorite set, but my timing on this Hindu back set may not have been the best.  

I do appreciate the encouragement, though!

Regards,
JP
